article: In learning English, one should first pay attention to listening and speaking. It is the ground work of reading and writing. You'd better  _  your best to speak while you do much listening.Don't be  _  of making mistakes.But be careful not to let them stop you from improving your  _  . While you are doing this, a good  _  is to write---keep a diary, write notes or letters. Then if you can, ask some others to go through  _  you have written and tell you where there is a mistake. Many mistakes in your speaking will be  _  found when you write. Through correcting the mistakes, you can do better in learning English. If you are slow in speaking, don't  _  about it. One of the helpful ways is reading, either aloud or to yourself. The important thing is to choose  _  interesting to read. It needn't be too difficult for you. When you are reading  _  this way, don't stop to  look up  the words if you can guess their meanings when they have nothing to do with the sentence. You can do that some other time.
